author: Salesforcecom
title: Salesforce Catalyst Fund Expands Access to Education and Helps Advance Climate Justice | PressReleasePoint
text: [Salesforcecom](/user/salesforcecom)on Thu, 02/29/2024 - 14:39 Today, Salesforce announced 15 grantees of its Catalyst Fund , which provides unrestricted capital to smaller and younger nonprofits focused on increasing access to quality education and advancing climate justice. Today, Salesforce announced 15 grantees of its [Catalyst Fund](https://www.salesforce.com/news/stories/salesforce-catalyst-fund-announcement/?amp) , which provides unrestricted capital to smaller and younger nonprofits focused on increasing access to quality education and advancing climate justice. Why it matters: Disparities in education quality remain a [significant challenge](https://cepa.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/wp19-06-v082022.pdf) , limiting socioeconomic opportunities for many individuals. Climate change also impacts the [most vulnerable communities](https://www.un.org/ohrlls/news/frontline-climate-crisis-worlds-most-vulnerable-nations-suffer-disproportionately) . These grants are helping smaller, younger organizations grow their programs and reach new audiences, innovate for solutions and test big ideas, and secure additional funding. - [Rese](https://ssir.org/articles/entry/effective_change_requires_proximate_leaders) [arch](https://ssir.org/articles/entry/effective_change_requires_proximate_leaders)shows that organizations with leaders embedded in the communities they serve have the experience, relationships, data, and knowledge necessary to develop effective solutions. - Nonprofits with unrestricted funding also demonstrate [greater resilience and capacity](https://cep.org/the-impact-of-large-unrestricted-grants-on-nonprofits-a-five-year-view/). This flexibility allows them to create and scale solutions by allocating resources to operational costs, technology, and outreach efforts. Go deeper: Salesforceâ€™s latest round of funding will allocate a total of $2 million to nonprofits to support 15 organizations across the United States, Australia, Canada, and the United Kingdom. - The fund has also extended its reach to include three organizations with a specific focus on climate justice to build the next generation of climate leaders and advance a just transition to a green economy. - With these latest contributions, the Catalyst Fund will have awarded a cumulative total of $6 million to 50 nonprofit partners since 2021. What theyâ€™re saying: - â€œWeâ€™re proud to support these exceptional organizations, recognizing that getting access to philanthropic capital is often harder for younger and smaller nonprofits. Weâ€™ve seen the transformative impact of our education Catalyst Fund partners and weâ€™re thrilled to broaden our reach to support climate justice organizations.â€ â€“ Becky Ferguson, SVP of Philanthropy at Salesforce & CEO of the Salesforce Foundation - â€œThe transition to clean energy is inevitable, but creating an equitable distribution of benefits takes intention. With unrestricted funding, I have greater capacity to focus on the most impactful work with young clean energy leaders instead of worrying about how to cover the core operations that are always so difficult for nonprofits.â€ â€“ Esther Morales, Catalyst Fund Grantee and Executive Director, CELI Weâ€™ve seen the transformative impact of our education Catalyst Fund partners and weâ€™re thrilled to broaden our reach to support climate justice organizations.Becky Ferguson, SVP of Philanthropy at Salesforce & CEO of the Salesforce Foundation New Catalyst Fund grantees: These 15 grantees are committed to driving access to education and economic opportunity and advancing climate justice in the communities they serve: - [America On Tech](https://www.americaontech.org/): Grew its tech sector partnerships, resulting in over $1.5 million in internship wages for students in the 2022-2023 school year. The organization also expanded to Miami and launched an alumni continuing education program. - [Coded By Kids](https://www.codedbykids.com/): Empowers underserved youth through tech education to prepare them for success in the innovation economy. - [Clean Energy Leadership Institute](https://www.cleanenergyleaders.org/): Equips young professionals with energy systems expertise and networks needed to accelerate the transition to a clean energy future. - [DeadlyScience](https://deadlyscience.org.au/): Enhanced operational efficiencies, streamlining school registration processes for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students, improving teacher conversion rates, and implementing automated feedback loops to better assess program outcomes. - [DREAMerâ€™s Roadmap](https://dreamersroadmap.org/): Supports undocumented students finding scholarships to go to college. - [Eight Million Stories](https://www.eightmillionstories.org/): Provides education and career readiness programs to young people who are justice-involved or have been disconnected from traditional schools. - [Football Beyond Borders](https://www.footballbeyondborders.org/)(FBB): Expanded its service reach by 25%, resulting in an increase of reach of students farthest from success. FBB also expanded to the West Midlands region and upskilled existing staff enhancing therapeutic offerings for young people. - [Kingmakers of Oakland](https://www.kingmakersofoakland.org/): Deepened relationships with the San Francisco United School District, served more than 1,000 students from Oakland, San Francisco, Seattle, and Suburban Atlanta, and has increased program funders. - [Profound Gentlemen](https://profoundgentlemen.org/): Supports male educators of color through professional development, mentorship, and community building. - [The Calculus Project](https://thecalculusproject.org/): Uses research-supported strategies to increase the number of underrepresented students who excel in advanced mathematics to prepare them for post-secondary opportunities in STEM. - [The Teachersâ€™ Lounge](https://theteachersloungema.org/): Offers professional development and support services to educators, with a focus on fostering collaboration and innovation in teaching. - [Sharing The Power Foundation](https://www.sharingthepower.org/): Works to build the next generation of diverse climate justice leaders through leadership development, advocacy, and community organizing. - [Visions of Science Network for Learning](https://www.vosnl.org/): Connects underserved youth to a pathway of STEM learning and engagement towards successful careers opportunities in STEM. - [Urban TXT](https://urbantxt.org/home): Urban TXT achieved near-perfect impact outcomes across key measures, doubled the reach of its hackathon program, expanded partnerships at the school district level, and continued placing low income youth in high paying jobs. - [Youth Negotiators Academy](https://www.youthnegotiators.org/): Develops the next cohort of climate leaders through training, mentorship, and opportunities for civic engagement.

author: Lupita Villarreal
title: Camp Mystic counselor Katherine Ferruzzo died in Hill Country flooding | 13wmaz.com
text:
HOUSTON â€” A counselor at Camp Mystic with Houston ties died in the July 4th flood in the Texas Hill Country, her family confirmed.
The body of Katherine Ferruzzo, a recent graduate of Memorial High School, was recovered Friday, according to a statement from her family.
"We are incredibly grateful to all the search and rescue professionals and volunteers who have remained steadfast in their efforts to locate the victims of this tragedy. We would especially like to thank the Texas Rangers," the family said.
Ferruzzo had been accepted to the University of Texas at Austin for the fall semester and planned to become a Special Education teacher.
Her family plans to establish the Katherine Ferruzzo Legacy Foundation to honor her "compassion for those with special needs and learning differences."
Below is the family's full statement
â€œOn Friday, July 11, 2025, Katherine Ferruzzoâ€™s remains were found. We are incredibly grateful to all the search and rescue professionals and volunteers who have remained steadfast in their efforts to locate the victims of this tragedy. We would especially like to thank the Texas Rangers.
Katherine, a recent graduate of Memorial High School, had been accepted to The University of Texas at Austin this fall and planned to become a Special Education teacher.
The Katherine Ferruzzo Legacy Foundation is being established to honor Katherine and her compassion for those with special needs and learning differences. We will share a link with donation details in the coming days.
We would like to thank the Houston and Camp Mystic communities for their unwavering support and for allowing us to mourn this tragedy in private. We are heartbroken for the other families and pray for all who have been affected.â€
More than 2 dozen campers, counselors from Camp Mystic killed in flood
On Monday, Camp Mystic said at least 27 campers and counselors were among the people killed in the devastating flooding in Central Texas.
That number continued to grow each day as searchers found more remains, but a few girls from the Christian summer camp remained missing.
By Friday, the total death toll in the flooding was at least 120 people with 170 unaccounted for.
Many of the victims were from the Houston area.
RELATED: These are the names and faces of Houston-area residents who lost their lives in the Hill Country flood

author: Agency Report
title: Zamfara To Pay Civil Servants 13th Month Salary
text: Governor Dauda Lawal of Zamfara State has authorised the payment of â€œ13th-month salariesâ€ to both state and local government workers as part of a welfare package for citizens. The Head of Service, Ahmed Liman, conveyed this directive in a circular issued in Gusau on Friday, as disclosed to the public. In a statement provided to journalists on Friday, the Senior Special Assistant to the Governor on Media and Publicity, Sulaiman Idris, highlighted this notable move as the first of its kind in the stateâ€™s history. Idris stated that this decision aligns with the state governmentâ€™s dedication to the welfare of workers and aims to inspire enhanced performance among the workforce. â€œToday, Governor Dauda Lawal has approved the payment of end-of-year bonuses to public and civil servants in the state. This gesture is intended to elevate the workersâ€™ spirits and offer them financial support during the holiday season. â€œThis action exemplifies Governor Lawalâ€™s commitment to implementing policies that improve working conditions, raise salaries, and create opportunities for career advancement for government workers. â€œThe disbursement of the 13th-month salary is just one among several initiatives geared towards empowering workers and fostering economic growth in the state.â€ (NAN)

author: TMNews
title: Zelensky visita ospedale, medaglie ai soldati feriti
text:
Zelensky visita ospedale, medaglie ai soldati feriti
Milano, 3 mag. (askanews) - Volodymyr Zelenskyj ha visitato l'ospedale di Khmelnytsky, dove vengono curati i soldati feriti. Il presidente ucraino ha assegnato medaglie "per il coraggio" e "per i servizi militari resi all'Ucraina" ai militari delle Forze armate ucraine e del Servizio statale della guardia di frontiera che sono rimasti feriti nell'est del paese, in particolare durante la difesa di Avdiivka, Mar nka e Tchassiv Yar, in direzione Bakhmout.

author: RedacciÃ³n LAVOZ
title: Juicio contra Alperovich por abuso sexual: un fiscal acusÃ³ a un testigo de haber mentido y pidiÃ³ su detenciÃ³n
text: En el marco del [juicio contra el exgobernador de TucumÃ¡n JosÃ© Alperovich, acusado por abuso sexual](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/sucesos/manzur-declaro-en-el-juicio-contra-alperovich-esto-le-debe-haber-causado-mucho-dolor-a-ella/), este jueves el fiscal Sandro Abraldes pidiÃ³ la inmediata detenciÃ³n del empresario VÃ­ctor Hugo Decataldo por falso testimonio. Es un testigo que trabajÃ³ con el tambiÃ©n exsenador durante su campaÃ±a a gobernador del 2019. Para el fiscal, â€œmintiÃ³ descaradamenteâ€ en su declaraciÃ³n. La acusaciÃ³n se dio luego de mostrar conversaciones de Ã©l con la presunta vÃ­ctima. Decataldo es un empresario tucumano que en el 2018 iniciÃ³ su relaciÃ³n polÃ­tica con [Alperovich](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/sucesos/manzur-declaro-en-el-juicio-contra-alperovich-esto-le-debe-haber-causado-mucho-dolor-a-ella/), al incorporarse al equipo de campaÃ±a. Tiempo despuÃ©s, comenzÃ³ una relaciÃ³n amorosa con Sara, la hija de Alperovich, convirtiÃ©ndose en una persona muy cercana al senador. Para el fiscal, el hombre mintiÃ³ en su testimonio. Lo descubriÃ³ a partir de los chats que fueron incorporados al expediente. De hecho, el empresario habrÃ­a â€œarmado una estrategiaâ€ en el 2019 para obtener informaciÃ³n de la denunciante. â€œYo querÃ­a saber quÃ© habÃ­a pasado en relaciÃ³n a esa denuncia. No tenÃ­a mucha relaciÃ³n con ella, mi relaciÃ³n era mÃ¡s con Sarita, la hija de Alperovich. Yo la veÃ­a mal porque se rumoreaba que esta chica iba a hacer una denuncia contra su padre. Entonces armÃ© una estrategia para que ella hablaraâ€, indicÃ³. El hombre dijo ante el juez Ramos Padilla que â€œintentÃ³ tener empatÃ­aâ€ con la mujer. â€œElla me contÃ³ que estaba sufriendo una situaciÃ³n difÃ­cil y le contestÃ©: â€˜JosÃ© es un animal, parece un alzadoâ€™. IntentÃ© tener empatÃ­a con ella, decirle que sÃ­ a todo e inventÃ© cosas. Fue una mala idea que se me ocurriÃ³, pido disculpasâ€. En los chats, la denunciante le reconociÃ³ al testigo que estaba siendo abusada por Alperovich, a lo que Ã©l le respondiÃ³: â€œYo te creo, tambiÃ©n fui violadoâ€. Pero durante el debate, el hombre indicÃ³ que ella â€œjamÃ¡s le habÃ­a dicho nadaâ€ sobre un supuesto ataque sexual. â€œPodrÃ­a haber plata de por medio, jajaâ€, le puso Decataldo a la denunciante en esa conversaciÃ³n por se llevÃ³ adelante por Instagram. â€œFue una broma, no lo dije en serioâ€, se justificÃ³ el testigo en el debate. Tras esto, el fiscal lo acusÃ³ y pidiÃ³ su detenciÃ³n inmediata: â€œUsted jurÃ³ ante el tribunal que iba a decir la verdad, pero estÃ¡ mintiendo descaradamenteâ€. La querella asintiÃ³ al pedido, por lo que serÃ¡ considerado por el juez al final del testimonio. â€œEl testigo nunca dijo que esto se trataba de una estrategia para manipular a la denunciante. ReciÃ©n lo trajo a colaciÃ³n en esta instancia. MintiÃ³â€, expresÃ³ uno de los abogados de la querella. â€œVÃ­ctor Decataldo contaba con informaciÃ³n de afuera. Queda claro que callÃ³ deliberadamente en la primera declaraciÃ³n testimonial. Queda claro que lo Ãºnico que hay genuino son esos chats. Lo que Ã©l sabe de este caso, estÃ¡ en ese chat, no lo que fue a exponer en TucumÃ¡n ni lo que vino a exponer acÃ¡â€, insistiÃ³ luego Abraldes. El juez Ramos Padilla decidiÃ³ esperar al final del debate para resolver: â€œNo veo la necesidad de pronunciarme ahora. Lo voy a hacer al final del juicio, es lo mÃ¡s produnte. Voy a escuchar a mÃ¡s testigosâ€.

author: Guillaume Lamy
title: Lyon : Le mal des pompiers
text:
La quasi-totalitÃ© des pompiers du RhÃ´ne, y compris les cadres, sont en â€œgrÃ¨ve illimitÃ©eâ€ pour demander plus de moyens financiers et humains Ã  leurs autoritÃ©s de tutelle : Ã‰tat, MÃ©tropole de Lyon et conseil dÃ©partemental.
â€œLe SDIS du Qatar.â€ La boutade a circulÃ© pleins gaz pendant des annÃ©es en interne, tant les sapeurs-pompiers lyonnais disposaient de gros moyens financiers, de belles casernes, de bons engins avant tout le monde et parmi les meilleures techniques opÃ©rationnelles du pays. Retour de flammes. Lâ€™incendie a pris. Le torchon brÃ»le dÃ©sormais entre les pompiers et leurs â€œfinanceursâ€, la MÃ©tropole de Lyon, le DÃ©partement du RhÃ´ne et, indirectement, lâ€™Ã‰tat : les caisses se vident, personne nâ€™arrive plus vraiment Ã  les remplir et, classique, chacun se renvoie la lance. â€œOn est au centre dâ€™une guÃ©guerre politiqueâ€, commente Anthony Fossat, le commandant adjoint au chef de groupement Est des sapeurs-pompiers du Service dÃ©partemental mÃ©tropolitain dâ€™incendie et de secours (SDMIS) et dÃ©lÃ©guÃ© Avenir Secours, syndicat majoritaire de lâ€™encadrement des pompiers. â€œNous, notre rÃ´le câ€™est de sauver les gens, dâ€™Ã©teindre des incendies, pas dâ€™aller chercher des financements, câ€™est le job des politiques !â€ , cuirasse RÃ©my Chabbouh, pompier et secrÃ©taire gÃ©nÃ©ral du syndicat Sud des pompiers locaux.
La colÃ¨re gronde, la tension est Ã  son maximum. Depuis le 1er octobre, 90 % des sapeurs-pompiers, officiers compris, sont ainsi en â€œgrÃ¨ve illimitÃ©eâ€. Ils dÃ©plorent le manque de moyens, les recrutements et demandent des hausses de salaires. Pour lâ€™instant, les secours sont assurÃ©s, mais le doute sâ€™installe.
Les pompiers du RhÃ´ne en chiffres
Les effectifs baissent, le nombre dâ€™interventions explose
En 2014, les 1 170 pompiers professionnels de Lyon et de la mÃ©tropole intervenaient 90 000 fois par an.
Dix ans plus tard, 1 070 pompiers (-100) interviennent 140 000 fois par an (+55,5 %)
Le dÃ©lai moyen dâ€™intervention des pompiers Ã  Lyon et dans la mÃ©tropole est passÃ© de 10 minutes en 2017 Ã  12 minutes 40 en 2024
100 casernes
pour 1 889 300 habitants dans 266 communes
6 490
sapeurs-pompiers (dont 20 % de professionnels) et
350 personnels, administratifs et spÃ©cialisÃ©s
1 appel dâ€™urgence/minute
1 intervention toutes les 4 minutes
269 prises en charge de victimes par jour

author: Pilar Espinoza
title: Â¿DÃ³nde regalan garrafones de agua en CDMX? UbicaciÃ³n de plantas potabilizadoras
text:
Â¡AtenciÃ³n Ciudad de MÃ©xico ! El gobierno capitalino ha puesto en marcha una iniciativa para combatir la escasez de agua que azota en el Valle de MÃ©xico, ofreciendo garrafones de agua potable gratis a quienes lo necesiten, Â¿cÃ³mo puedes solicitar el tuyo? Estas son las ubicaciones de las plantas potabilizadoras en CDMX .
Â¿DÃ³nde puedo obtener mis garrafones gratis en CDMX? El Gobierno de la CDMX ha instalado 3 plantas potabilizadoras de agua en las diferentes alcaldÃ­as de la capital del paÃ­s, donde los habitantes podrÃ¡n acudir para llenar sus garrafones, o bien, en caso de no contar con un recipiente, se les obsequiarÃ¡ sin costo alguno, Â¿dÃ³nde se encuentran?
AlcaldÃ­a Iztapalapa. Benito JuÃ¡rez. CoyoacÃ¡n: Centro de Salud JuÃ¡rez Maza, colonia Pedregal de Santo Domingo. Las plantas potabilizadoras ubicadas en la Ciudad de MÃ©xico son operadas por el EjÃ©rcito mexicano y se encargan de potabilizar diariamente cerca mil 200 litros de agua para ser distribuidos entre las personas que les hace falta el lÃ­quido vital.
ðŸ’§Â¡Agua limpia para todos! ðŸ¤
â›² En la Ciudad de MÃ©xico, mejoramos la infraestructura hÃ­drica para un futuro mÃ¡s saludable y sostenible. ðŸš¿ Por ello, en coordinaciÃ³n con @SacmexCDMX , hemos rehabilitado 42 plantas potabilizadoras para brindarte agua de calidad y mejorar elâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/ST4YmywpCC

Estos son los requisitos para la entrega de garrafones gratis en CDMX Para recibir el apoyo de agua potable sin costo alguno, el gobierno de la CDMX solicita a los habitantes cumplir con los siguientes requisitos :
Llevar tus propios garrafones vacÃ­os y en buen estado. En caso de no contar con uno se te darÃ¡ gratis. Presentar un comprobante de domicilio de la CDMX o Edomex. Acudir en horario de atenciÃ³n de las plantas potabilizadoras, de lunes a viernes de 9:00 a 18:00 horas y sÃ¡bados de 9:00 a 13:00 horas. Â¡TÃ³malo en cuenta! La disponibilidad de garrafones puede variar segÃºn la planta potabilizadora. Se recomienda consultar las redes sociales del SACMEX para obtener informaciÃ³n actualizada.
Â¿CuÃ¡l es el nivel de las presas del Sistema Cutzamala? De acuerdo con la ComisiÃ³n Nacional del Agua ( Conagua ), hasta el corte del pasado 15 de julio, el nivel de las presas del Sistema Cutzamala , que abastecen a una cuarta parte del consumo de agua en el Valle de MÃ©xico, se encuentra en un 29.1% de su llenado total. Esto representa un aumento leve en comparaciÃ³n con el 26.9% registrado a principios de julio
Cabe destacar que pese al aumento registrado gracias a las lluvias, el nivel actual sigue siendo bajo en comparaciÃ³n con aÃ±os anteriores. Por ejemplo, en 2023, las presas se encontraban al 50% de su capacidad en esta misma fecha.

author: @uwyo
title: UW, Eastern Wyoming College Esports Team Up to Enhance Emerging Tech and Career Experience
text: [Apply to UW](/admissions/apply.html)[Programs & Majors](https://search.uwyo.edu/s/search.html?collection=uwyo-program-finder-meta&displayMode=card)[Admissions](/admissions/index.html)[Cost & Financial Aid](/sfa/index.html)[Current Students](/uw/current-students.html)[Academics](#)[UW Life](#)[Research](#)[About UW](#) [+Application Login](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Login) [Apply to UW](/admissions/apply.html) Contact Us Institutional Communications Bureau of Mines Building, Room 137 Laramie, WY 82071 Phone: (307) 766-2929 Email: [cbaldwin@uwyo.edu](mailto:cbaldwin@uwyo.edu) Published October 17, 2024 A strategic partnership aimed at enhancing competitive gaming and emerging technologies in the state has been established by the University of Wyoming Esports Club, Eastern Wyoming College (EWC) Esports and UWâ€™s Center for Blockchain and Digital Innovation (CBDI). This collaborative effort focuses on educational development, technological innovation and community engagement, says Joey Marchand, a CBDI assistant and partnership coordinator. Marchand worked with Aaron Krapes, UW Esports Club president, and EWC Esports Head Coach Caleb Spitzer. The initiative is designed to encourage esports club and team members to enhance academic offerings at both institutions while contributing to Wyomingâ€™s economic diversification by cultivating a skilled workforce in high-tech fields, Marchand says. â€œThis collaboration aims to create unprecedented opportunities for students in the realms of competitive gaming and emerging technologies,â€ Marchand says. He says students, educators and industry partners are invited to join the venture, which aims to involve more Wyoming community colleges and schools in the future. â€œThis cooperative effort will allow us to continue to grow the esports community at UW and across the state of Wyoming,â€ Krapes says. â€œIt will also give us the opportunity to assist other colleges and high schools in developing their esports programs, with the goal of stimulating academic engagement and, most importantly, enjoying the many benefits that competitive esports allow.â€ In a news release issued by EWC Esports, Spitzer expressed enthusiasm for the partnership's potential impact on the state. â€œEsports has the incredible potential to not only reach students who might otherwise miss out on traditional sports, but to equip students to take their experiences, merging teamwork and technology, back into Wyoming,â€ Spitzer says. He adds that as more schools and colleges include these programs, the benefits for the state as a whole grow exponentially. Steve Lupien, the Ada Lovelace Director of CBDI, says the center is sponsoring the UW esports clubâ€™s partnership. It represents a forward-thinking approach to education and technology, combining the competitive spirit of esports with the innovative potential of blockchain and digital technologies, he says. â€œIt aims to position Wyoming as a hub for esports excellence and technological innovation, potentially attracting new talent and industries to the state,â€ Lupien says. â€œEsports has shown that it connects students to academic programs and careers in computer science, cybersecurity, AI, robotics and blockchain.â€ This initiative comes at a time when both esports and blockchain technologies are seeing rapid growth and increased interest from various sectors, he says. â€œBy joining forces, these Wyoming institutions are positioning themselves at the forefront of these emerging fields,â€ Lupien says. UW will participate in the EWC Fortnite Invitational Saturday, Oct. 19, starting at noon in the EWC game room. The event is in partnership with the Wyoming Army National Guard and will include teams from other Wyoming community colleges and high schools. A 2017 UW graduate, 1st Lt. Garrett Stanfill, head of the Wyoming Guard esports program, helped arrange the competition. Sponsored by CBDI, the, the event can be viewed on the official EWC Twitch stream at [https://www.twitch.tv/ewcesports](https://www.twitch.tv/ewcesports). For more information about this partnership and how to get involved, email Marchand at [jmarchan@uwyo.edu](mailto:jmarchan@uwyo.edu), Spitzer at [cspitzer@ewc.wy.edu](mailto:cspitzer@ewc.wy.edu) or Aaron Krapes at [akrapes@uwyo.edu](mailto:akrapes@uwyo.edu). Contact Us Institutional Communications Bureau of Mines Building, Room 137 Laramie, WY 82071 Phone: (307) 766-2929 Email: [cbaldwin@uwyo.edu](mailto:cbaldwin@uwyo.edu)

author: Deena Centofanti and David Komer
title: 'Holiday Heart Syndrome' comes with over-indulging for the holidays, says doctor | FOX 2 Detroit
text:
FOX 2 - It's hard to not overindulge this time of the year - and for the most part that can just lead to a little discomfort, but in some cases, all the treats, along with booze or caffeine, can lead to some real heart issues.
It can be easy to overindulge at holiday parties youâ€™re catching up with family and friends, eating all kinds of delicious food, and the alcohol may be flowing freely too.
Doctor Deborah Plate with Cleveland Clinic explains, itâ€™s best to keep moderation in mind.
"We can overindulge with lots of goodies that might be a lot different than what we typically do throughout the year," she said. "So, a lot of times we will take in quite a bit of salt, quite a bit of sugar, and certainly along with that during the holidays can be overindulging with alcohol.
"And when all that comes at us, we certainly can, at times, find that perhaps we don't feel good. Some folks might realize that they actually have perhaps racing heart or chest discomfort, shortness of breath."
Doctor Plate says the condition is known as â€˜Holiday Heart Syndromeâ€™ and it can be caused by too much alcohol and salty foods. Those with existing heart issues are considered most at risk.
However, anyone can be diagnosed with it. Doctor Plate says if you do start to experience any of the symptoms she mentioned, like a racing heart, chest discomfort, or shortness of breath, you should stop drinking immediately.
Holiday Heart Syndrome usually resolves on its own but, if symptoms persist, you should go to the emergency department.
"Things to think about, or look for, are chest discomfort," Plate said. "I don't always say chest pain because oftentimes it's pressure or discomfort. And so, anything that's different than normal is important. heartburn that does not improve with something over the counter in the way of an antacid needs to be investigated. shortness of breath, it's different than usual.
"I often talk to my patients about walking across a flat surface and are you short of breath? We all get a little shorter breath with stairs, but a flat surface shortness of breath concerns me."
Plate says if you do plan to drink alcohol at a holiday party, be sure to pace yourself and switch off with some water.
You could also eat less during the day so you can eat more at the party or eat right before so youâ€™re less tempted to overindulge.
Health Works Sponsored by Corewell Health
